snippet: The disappointing jobs report leaves President Obama with fading hopes that the economy will surge before Election Day, straining his argument that he has put the country on the right path.
abstract: News analysis; disappointing jobs report leaves Pres Obama and his advisers with fading hopes that the economy will surge ahead before Election Day; Obama campaign has claimed that Democrats have reversed the economic free fall and put millions back to work, argument that is increasingly difficult to make in light of lackluster jobs reports month after month.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ANNIE LOWREY
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Iowa City, and Annie Lowrey from Washington. Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting from Sioux City, Iowa.

lead_paragraph: The disappointing jobs report leaves President Obama with fading hopes that the economy will surge before Election Day, straining his argument that he has put the country on the right path.

headline.seo: After Political Conventions, It’s Still the Economy
headline.main: A Day After the Party, It’s Still the Economy
headline.print_headline: A Day Later, It’s Still the Economy
